meanings.definition: Relating to or denoting the fourth epoch of the Tertiary period, between the Oligocene and Pliocene epochs.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the miocene fossils to learn about ancient times.
meanings.sent2: During the miocene period, many new species of animals evolved.
meanings.sent3: The miocene rocks seemed to whisper secrets of the past to the curious geologist.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a miocene wisdom beyond her years.
meanings.sent5: The miocene landscape painted a vivid picture of prehistoric life.

meanings.definition: A plant or animal living during the Miocene epoch.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a miocene mammal skeleton for visitors to see.
meanings.sent2: The miocene plants thrived in the ancient forests of that time.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel in the park claimed to be a miocene creature in disguise.
meanings.sent4: His pet dog seemed to have the spirit of a miocene explorer on its adventures.
meanings.sent5: The zoo welcomed a new exhibit featuring miocene animals from long ago.
